intro: Ardisia albovirens, commonly known as the white-veined beautyberry, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its striking white veins on its dark green leaves. The plant produces small, fleshy berries that are typically a bright red or orange color when mature. These berries are an important food source for various birds and small mammals. Ardisia albovirens is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and unique fruit.
